New Records: The starting pitcher matchup of Spencer Schwellenbach (ATL) and Simeon Woods-Richardson (MIN) was the longest-named matchup in baseball history.
Key Match Events: The game went into extra-innings with the Atlanta Braves beating the Minnesota Twins by a score of 8-6.
Pre-Game Insights: Atlanta is out superstar Spencer Strider for the rest of the season due to Tommy John surgery.
Post-Match Reflections: The win moved the Braves to 72-60 while dropping the Twins to the same record, both teams are currently in possession of the third and final wild card spots in their respective leagues.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The two teams are in action again on Wednesday night with first pitch coming at 7:40 p.m. ET.
Others: Spencer Schwellenbach gave up just five hits and no runs, he walked three and struck out eight.
